name: 都市地理
description: The aim of the course is to introduce students to contemporary urban geography which theoretically reflects the pressing issues facing urban populations. Particular stress is laid upon the urban classics written in the last 150 years that constitutes the themes of contemporary urban studies. In doing so, this course also encourages students to examine their own cities and the associated social, economic, political, cultural, and environmental problems.
goals: To be familiar with the  theories and concepts of urban geography.
To apply and comprehend approaches in urban geography to real-life examples.
To critically analyze topics related to urban geography using concepts and methods from the course, and be able to articulate this in the form of a presentation and report.

科目名稱（英文）：Urban Geography

授課教師：王文誠    Email:  wwang@ntnu.edu.tw  
Office Hours: 每星期四 12:10-14:00、星期五 12:10-14:00（請預約）

教師專長背景：經濟地理、都市與區域規劃、都市地理、都市政治與政策

一、教學目標

某種意義上，都市地理是經濟地理的結晶（urban geography is crystallised economic geography）。儘管如此，自然/社會/文化/政治等觀點，塑造形式和都市地理的意義。該課程主要目的是，介紹當代都市地理學的主要辯論，試圖瞭解世界所面臨主要城市的發展課題。本課程鼓勵學生調查自己的城市和各種鏈接到城市的相關的自然、社會、經濟、政治、文化和環境問題。

這學期都市地理課程將討論「新自由義化 (neoliberalisation)」在都市地理中的作用與制度中介，及其所引發的行星都市化(planetary urbanization)及其反動的地方營造網絡(provincializing urban theory)。其次，種族主義與都市治理來討論都市生活；接著，人類世(Anthropocene)、靭性城市、智慧城市與都市化的課題所構成最新近都市地理學反思三部曲。並且討論「新自由義化(neoliberalisation)」、「仕紳化(gentrification)」、「本真性(authenticity)」、「後政治(the post-political)」等主題在都市地理中的作用與制度中介。我們將扣合全球時勢，從臺灣的經驗出發，自然、社會、經濟、政治、文化、和環境等課題，討論最新的國際主流都市地理學術理論。

然而，探索主題，我們試圖翻轉教室，以問題導向互換位置教學法，由同學來倡議都市議題；並且，導讀其所倡議的主題文獻及田野調查的結果，提供所有課堂參與者討論。

二、教材可能主題與內容

Urban geography is the subdiscipline of geography which concentrates on those parts of the Earth's surface that have a high concentration of buildings and infrastructure. Predominantly towns and cities, these are settlements with a high population density and with the majority of economic activities in the secondary sector and tertiary sectors.

Urban geographers are primarily concerned with the ways in which cities and towns are constructed, governed and experienced. Contrary to neighboring disciplines such as urban anthropology[\[1\]](applewebdata://30B55DB1-5CA6-498E-8E44-4442DFEF6593#_ftn1), urban planning and urban sociology, urban geography mostly investigates the impact of urban processes on the earth's surface's social and physical structures. Urban geographical research can be part of both human geography and integrated geography.

There are essentially two approaches to urban geography: the investigation of **_systems of cities_** and research on **_cities as systems_**, as I call it **_‘crystallised economic geography’_**. The first approach involves the study of problems relating to the spatial distribution of cities themselves and the complex patterns of movement, flows and linkages that bind them in space. The second approach is on the study of patterns of distribution and interaction within cities, essentially the study of their inner structure.

methodologies.note: This course is to be taught/learned by lecturing as well as open space technique. The 3-hour class is divided into 2 sessions. In the first session (90 mins), the instructors (including teacher and the leading students) will give a lecture to highlight the main issues discussed in the textbook and fieldwork. All the students are required to read the assigned readings before attending the class and participate actively in the class.
